description: This make-ahead Thanksgiving stuffing is a savory blend of herbs, bread, and vegetables that will elevate your holiday feast. Prepare it in advance for a stress-free celebration, allowing the flavors to meld beautifully.
instructions: In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add celery and onion, cooking until softened.
In a large bowl, combine the bread cubes, cooked vegetables, herbs, salt, and pepper.
Pour chicken broth over the mixture, stirring to combine.
Transfer to a greased baking dish and bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown.
tips: For the best flavor, use day-old bread and feel free to add in your favorite nuts or dried fruits.

structured_content.content: This stuffing is a holiday classic that brings warmth and comfort to your Thanksgiving table. The combination of fresh herbs and savory vegetables creates a delightful aroma that fills your kitchen, making it a dish everyone will look forward to.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 30 minutes
  • Perfect for Thanksgiving or any festive gathering
  • Can be prepared ahead of time, saving you stress on the big day
  • Uses simple ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Customizable with your favorite add-ins like sausage or nuts

structured_content.content: Growing up, stuffing was always the highlight of our Thanksgiving meal. My grandmother would make a huge batch, and the whole family would gather around the table, eagerly waiting for the first scoop. It's a dish filled with love and memories.

• Main ingredient: Use a hearty bread like sourdough or French for the best texture and flavor.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Fresh herbs like sage and thyme are essential for that classic stuffing taste.
  • Supporting ingredients: Celery and onion add moisture and depth to the stuffing.
  • Equipment needed: A large skillet and a baking dish are essential for this recipe.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Start by cubing the bread and letting it dry out for a few hours or overnight for the best texture.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Cook the vegetables until soft, then mix with the bread and broth before baking until golden.
Finishing Touches:
Let it cool slightly before serving to allow the flavors to settle.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Ensure your bread is dried out to prevent a mushy stuffing.
  • Avoid overcooking; it should be moist but not soggy.
  • The stuffing is ready when the top is golden brown and crispy.
  • Store leftovers in the fridge and reheat in the oven for best results.

structured_content.content: This stuffing is not just a side dish; it's a centerpiece of our family gatherings. Sharing it with loved ones creates a sense of togetherness that makes every holiday special.
Consider adding cooked sausage for a heartier dish, or dried cranberries for a touch of sweetness. You can also experiment with different herbs like rosemary or parsley for a unique twist.
This stuffing pairs beautifully with roasted turkey, gravy, and cranberry sauce. Serve it alongside mashed potatoes and green beans for a complete holiday meal.
For a gluten-free version, use gluten-free bread. You can also make it vegan by substituting butter with olive oil and using vegetable broth.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Toast the bread cubes for extra crunch.
  • Let the stuffing sit for a few minutes before serving to enhance the flavors.
  • Use a meat thermometer to check the doneness of the stuffing if cooked inside the turkey.
  • Garnish with fresh herbs for an impressive presentation.

structured_content.content: Embrace the joy of cooking this stuffing and share it with your loved ones. It's a dish that brings everyone together and creates lasting memories around the table.
